name: Statistical Methods for Whole Genome Analyses
body:
The note is entirely written inside Jupeter notebooks.
> Why [Jupyter notebook](http://www.nature.com/news/interactive-notebooks-sharing-the-code-1.16261)? [Juliabox](https://www.juliabox.org) can be used to easily check this notebook. ####About ANS656 Instructor: * Rohan Fernando (rohan@iastate.edu) TA: * Hao Cheng (haocheng@iastate.edu) ###Content * Section 1:  **Basic** * [1.1](basic/MapFunction.ipynb)   Map Funtions * [1.2](basic/RecProb.ipynb)   Computation of Recombination Probabilities * [1.3](basic/LD.ipynb)   Linkage Disequilibrium * Section 2:  **Bayesian Methods** * [2.1](Bayes/BayesTheorem.ipynb)   Bayesian Theorem * [2.2](Bayes/BayesInference.ipynb)   Bayesian Inference * [2.3](Bayes/MCMC.ipynb)   Markov Chain Monte-Carlo Methods * [2.4](Bayes/BayesSimpleLinear.ipynb)   Bayesian Inference by Application to Simple Linear Regression * [2.5](Bayes/BayesMultipleRegression.ipynb)   Extension to Multiple Linear Regression * [2.6](Bayes/BayesGWAS.ipynb)   Bayesian Regression Models for Whole-Genome Analyses * Section 3:  **Single Step** * [3.1](singleStep/ssGBLUP.ipynb)   Single-Step GBLUP * [3.2](singleStep/ssBayes.ipynb)   Single-Step Bayesian Regression * Section 4:  Other * [4.1](ssGBLUP.ipynb) * [4.2](ss.ipynb)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
